gmacsr 0.1
  • Reference

Estimate Distribution of OFL

Source: R/gmacs_do_ofl_dist.R
gmacs_do_ofl_dist.Rd

Run GMACS with MCMC of reference point calculation.

gmacs_do_ofl_dist(
  gmacs.dat,
  n_replicates,
  n_draws,
  wait = T,
  save_plot = T,
  plot_dir = NULL,
  model_name = NULL,
  version = NULL
)

Arguments

gmacs.dat

File path to gmacs.dat file.

n_replicates

Length of MCMC chain.

n_draws

Number of draws to save.

wait

Passed to shell(): a logical (not NA) indicating whether the R interpreter should wait for the command to finish, or run it asynchronously. Default = T.

save_plot

T/F save plot. Default = T.

plot_dir

Null. Directory in which to save plot. If NULL, a directory called 'plots' will be created in the same directory as gmacs.dat.

model_name

NULL. Character string to save as object in output, later to be used for plot legends. Example: "23.1b".

version

NULL. Character string denoting GMACS version. Default: "2.20.16".

Value

A subdirectory called 'ofl_distribution' will be created in the same directory as the gmacs.dat file. Within './ofl_distribution' the model version with MCMC will be run. The plot will be saved in the provided directory or output as a list include mcoutREF if save_plot = F.

Examples

gmacs_do_ofl_dist(gmacs.dat = "./AIGKC/models/2024/may/EAG/23.1b/gmacs.dat",n_replicates = 1000000, n_draws = 1000)
#> Error in file(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection
